insurer_name: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd (acting on behalf of insurer shown on Schedule)
coverage_summary: Comprehensive home insurance providing coverage for buildings, contents, personal possessions, valuables, pedal cycles, and various liability covers. Includes standard cover with optional accidental damage and additional extensions.
key_inclusions: Buildings cover including fixtures, fittings, permanent structures, solar panels, wind turbines
Contents cover for household goods, personal property, and business equipment (up to £5,000)
Alternative accommodation/loss of rent (up to 20% of sum insured)
Contents temporarily removed from home (up to 20% for 120 days)
Fatal injury cover (£5,000-£10,000 depending on age)
Replacement locks (up to £500 per claim, £2,500 annual limit)
Garden plants and shrubs (up to £1,000 annual)
key_exclusions: Wear and tear, corrosion, damp, mould, dry/wet rot, fungus, gradual deterioration
Maintenance and normal upkeep costs
Loss or damage while property is unoccupied (60+ days)
Terrorism
War, invasion, civil war, rebellion, revolution, insurrection
Nuclear contamination and radioactive materials
Pollution and contamination (except specific circumstances)
Sonic bangs from aircraft
Vermin, insects, pets or domesticated animals
Mechanical or electrical breakdown/failure
Faulty workmanship, materials or design (except property owner liability)
Damage from contractors' activities
Business use (except specified business equipment)
Motorised vehicles or craft (with specific exceptions)
Reduction in value after repair
Confiscation or detention by authorities
Riot or civil commotion outside United Kingdom
Subsidence to drives, patios, terraces, walls, gates, fences (unless main building damaged)
Coastal or riverbank erosion
Settlement, shrinkage or expansion
Storm damage to fences and gates
Frost damage (to underground services and certain circumstances)
Theft without evidence of forced entry when property is let/sublet
Loss by deception (except deception solely to enter property)
Theft from unoccupied property
Damage from trees being cut down within the home grounds
Cyber loss (for Section 8 - Claims Preparation Assistance)

coverage_limits.buildings_sum_insured: As shown on Schedule - includes index linking monthly
coverage_limits.contents_sum_insured: As shown on Schedule - includes index linking monthly
coverage_limits.valuables_within_home: Up to 33% of Contents sum insured, single article/collection limit 10%
coverage_limits.alternative_accommodation: Up to 20% of Buildings/Contents sum insured per claim
coverage_limits.loss_of_oil_or_metered_water: £1,000 per period of insurance (combined Sections 1 and 2)

sub_limits.contents_temporarily_removed: 20% of Contents sum insured for up to 120 days
sub_limits.contents_in_storage: 20% of Contents sum insured, max 60 days
sub_limits.matching_sets_buildings: Up to 50% cost of replacing undamaged parts
sub_limits.matching_sets_contents: Up to 50% cost of replacing undamaged parts
sub_limits.accidental_damage_porcelain: 10% of Contents sum insured for porcelain, china, glass, brittle articles

special_conditions: Home must be maintained in good state of repair
Must notify insurer of any changes to circumstances
Must comply with all endorsements on Schedule
Sums insured must represent full value at all times
For valuables over £2,500, must hold valuation no more than 3 years old
Jewellery over £7,500 must be inspected by professional jeweller every 3 years
When claiming for unattended pedal cycle theft over £1,500, must use 'Sold Secure Gold' standard lock
Must report theft to police within 24 hours and obtain crime reference
Must report riot to police within 7 days
Must not dispose of damaged items before inspection
Must not admit liability in liability claims
If paying by instalments and claim settled, must continue payments to renewal
Unoccupied definition: not lived in for 60+ days (must occupy 5 nights/row per month OR 2 nights/row per week)
Index linking applies monthly to Buildings and Contents
Policy operates on new-for-old basis (except certain items with wear and tear)
excess_deductible: As shown on Schedule - varies by section and claim type. Applied per claim/incident.

geographical_coverage.buildings: At address shown on Schedule (United Kingdom)
geographical_coverage.contents: At address shown on Schedule (United Kingdom)

age_restrictions.general_coverage: No specific age restrictions for policyholder mentioned

pre_existing_conditions: Not applicable - this is property/liability insurance, not health insurance

cancellation_policy.cooling_off_period: 14 days from receipt of documents or start date (whichever is later)
cancellation_policy.cooling_off_refund: Full refund if cover not commenced; pro-rata if commenced (no refund if claim made)
cancellation_policy.customer_cancellation_after_cooling_off: Pro-rata refund for unused cover (no refund if claim made/in progress)
cancellation_policy.insurer_cancellation: 7 days written notice, pro-rata refund (no refund if claim made/in progress)
cancellation_policy.cancellation_reasons: Non-payment, change of circumstances, non-disclosure, fraud, failure to cooperate, breach of conditions
cancellation_policy.instalment_plans: If claim settled, must continue payments to renewal or amount deducted from settlement

endorsements.name: Security Requirements
endorsements.description: May specify required locks, alarms, or security devices
endorsements.cost_impact: Affects premium; failure to comply may void cover
endorsements.coverage_impact: Non-compliance may result in claim rejection or non-payment

endorsements.name: Unoccupied Property
endorsements.coverage_impact: Significant restrictions on theft, water damage, malicious damage cover

endorsements.name: Subsidence Exclusion/Excess
endorsements.description: May exclude or increase excess for subsidence claims

endorsements.name: Structural Works Exclusion
endorsements.description: Restrictions during building works, extensions, renovations
endorsements.coverage_impact: Must notify before works commence; may exclude certain perils during works

endorsements.name: High Value Items
endorsements.description: Specified items listed individually with values
endorsements.cost_impact: Increases premium based on declared value
endorsements.coverage_impact: Increases limit for specified valuable items

endorsements.name: Let Property
endorsements.description: Additional terms for properties that are rented/let
endorsements.coverage_impact: Modifies theft requirements (need forced entry evidence)

endorsements.name: Excess Variations
endorsements.coverage_impact: Changes amount customer pays per claim

claims_requirements.notification_timeframe: As soon as possible after discovery; theft/riot/malicious damage within 24 hours (theft to police); riot within 7 days (to police)
required_documents: Police crime reference number (for theft, riot, malicious damage, lost property away from home)
Purchase receipts or proof of ownership
Utility bills or local authority bills
Proof of Sold Secure lock ownership (for cycle claims away from home)
Evidence of alarm maintenance contract (if required by endorsement)
process_steps: 1. Check if policy covers the loss/damage by reviewing Schedule
2. Take immediate steps to prevent further damage
3. For theft/criminal damage: Report to police within 24 hours and obtain crime reference
4. For riot: Report to police within 7 days
5. For credit card theft: Report to police and card company within 24 hours
6. Contact claims department on 08000 327327 (24/7) or through broker/agent
7. Do NOT dispose of damaged items before inspection
8. Do NOT carry out permanent repairs before inspection
9. Take reasonable steps to recover missing property
10. Provide all requested documentation and cooperate with investigation
12. For liability claims: Send all correspondence immediately without admitting liability
13. Allow insurer access to damaged property
14. Claims over £20,000: Claims Preparation Assistance may be offered
claims_requirements.evidence_requirements: Police reports (crime reference number for theft/criminal damage), original receipts, valuations (for items over £2,500, must be within 3 years), photographs, proof of ownership, proof of security measures (locks/alarms), utility bills, repair estimates
claims_requirements.claims_contact: 24 Hour Claim Reporting Line: 08000 327327 (available 24/7, 365 days) OR Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd, 4th Floor, Lanyon Building, North Derby Street, Belfast, BT15 3HL OR through broker/agent shown on Schedule

eligibility_criteria.age_limits: No specific age restrictions for policyholder mentioned
eligibility_criteria.occupational_restrictions: Business use restricted to clerical work only (Business Equipment up to £5,000)
eligibility_criteria.residency_requirements: Must be private residential property in United Kingdom; persons normally living together qualify as 'You'
other_restrictions: Property must not be used for illegal activities
Property must be maintained in good state of repair
Must disclose criminal convictions (other than driving offences)
Must notify if property becomes unoccupied
Must notify if property is let/sublet
Building works over certain thresholds require notification (extensions, load-bearing wall work, roofing 20%+, structural/demolition work, works costing 50%+ of sum insured)
Not available if previous subsidence claim at the property (for Claims Preparation Assistance section only)

policy_definitions.Accidental Damage: Sudden, unexpected and unintentional physical damage
policy_definitions.Bodily Injury: Physical injury, death or disease caused by sudden, unexpected, external and visible event
policy_definitions.Buildings: The home, fixtures & fittings, permanent structures within boundary including tennis courts, patios, drives, walls, fences, gates, hedges, drains, pipes, cables, tanks, swimming pools, solar panels, wind turbines, ground source heating pumps
policy_definitions.Contents: Household goods, personal property and Business Equipment within the Home belonging to you or you're legally responsible for. Includes tenant's fixtures, aerials, hot tubs (not permanent), deeds/documents (£1,500 limit), stamps/coins collections (£2,500 limit), Valuables (33% Contents sum insured, 10% single item limit)
policy_definitions.Excess: The first part of any claim you have to pay as stated on Schedule or Endorsement
policy_definitions.Home: The private dwelling and domestic outbuildings and garages at the address on Schedule
policy_definitions.Money: Cash, cheques, postal orders, unused postage stamps (not collections), savings stamps/certificates, share certificates, premium bonds, luncheon vouchers, travellers cheques, travel tickets, season tickets, phone cards, gift tokens - NOT including event tickets or business items
policy_definitions.Motorised Vehicle or Craft: Mechanically propelled/assisted vehicles including motorcycles, quad bikes, trikes, go karts, trailers, caravans, aircraft, drones, hovercraft, boats, sailboards - EXCLUDING domestic gardening vehicles, mobility scooters/wheelchairs, golf carts, remote-controlled toys
policy_definitions.Personal Possessions: Items that you wear, use or carry about your person, belonging to you or you're legally responsible for. NOT including contact lenses, dentures, dental work
policy_definitions.Period of Insurance: Length of time insurance is in force as shown on Schedule, for which premium paid and accepted
policy_definitions.Storm: Violent weather with: wind 48+ knots (55mph) OR rain 25mm+ per hour OR snow 30cm+ in 24 hours OR hail breaking glass/damaging hard surfaces
policy_definitions.Subsidence: Downward movement of ground beneath Buildings (other than Settlement)
policy_definitions.Heave: Upward or sideways movement of ground beneath Buildings caused by soil expanding
policy_definitions.Settlement: Downward movement of properties after built, caused by compression of soil
policy_definitions.Tenant: Occupier of Home when let (including holiday lets) OR leaseholder
policy_definitions.Unoccupied: a) Furnished but not lived in for 60+ days in a row (must be occupied 5 nights/row each month OR 2 nights/row each week) OR b) Insufficiently furnished for normal habitation
policy_definitions.Valuables: Jewellery, furs, gold, silver, precious metals, gems, stones, pictures, paintings, works of art
policy_definitions.You/Your: Person named as policyholder on Schedule and: husband, wife, partner (living as married), civil partner, children, parents, relatives - who normally live with them
policy_definitions.Domestic Staff: Person employed for private domestic duties at Home, not employed in any trade/profession/employment capacity
policy_definitions.Terrorism: Use of biological, chemical, nuclear force or contamination by any person/group for political, religious, ideological purposes including influencing government or causing public fear
policy_definitions.Business Equipment: Computer equipment (including software but excluding data) and office equipment used for clerical purposes in connection with business run from Home

time_sensitive_requirements.waiting_periods: None specified - cover starts from inception date on Schedule

notification_deadlines.general_claims: As soon as possible after discovery
notification_deadlines.credit_card_theft: Within 24 hours to police and card company (ideally)

time_sensitive_requirements.claims_deadlines: Not specified, but unreasonable delay may affect settlement
time_sensitive_requirements.cooling_off_period: 14 days from receipt of policy documents or start date (whichever is later)
time_sensitive_requirements.temporary_removal_limits: Contents temporarily removed: 120 days; Contents in professional storage: 60 days max; Household removals in storage: 72 hours

fca_disclosures: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd FCA number: 307105
Insurer details shown on Schedule - authorized by PRA, regulated by FCA and PRA
Details can be checked on Financial Services Register at www.fca.org.uk or 0800 111 6768
Financial Services Compensation Scheme (FSCS) coverage disclosed
Duty of fair presentation and disclosure requirements explained
Right to cancel within 14 days explained
regulatory_compliance.ipid_key_info: Not included in this document - would be separate IPID document
regulatory_compliance.fair_treatment_obligations: Clear explanation of policy terms, definitions provided, claims process explained, complaints procedure detailed, premium calculation basis disclosed (index linking), cancellation rights explained, consequences of non-disclosure explained

complaints_process.step_1: Contact claims department (if claim-related) or Prestige/insurer (if policy-related)
complaints_process.contact_details: Prestige Underwriting Services Ltd, 4th Floor, Lanyon Building, North Derby Street, Belfast, BT15 3HL; Phone: 08000 327327; Email: complaints@prestigeunderwriting.co.uk
complaints_process.information_needed: Name, address, postcode, phone, email, property address, policy/claim number, policy type, broker name, reason for complaint
complaints_process.step_2: If dissatisfied after final response, can refer to Financial Ombudsman Service within 6 months
complaints_process.FOS_contact: Exchange Tower, London E14 9SR; Phone: 0300 123 9123 / 0800 023 4567; Email: complaint.info@financial-ombudsman.org.uk; Website: help.financial-ombudsman.org.uk
complaints_process.alternative: Can use Alternative Dispute Resolution Provider (ADRP) within 12 months - list at www.tradingstandards.uk/advice/AlternativeDisputeResolution.cfm
complaints_process.legal_rights: Does not affect right to take legal action

regulatory_warnings: Policy may be cancelled if false information provided
All claims may be refused if fraud detected
Premiums may be retained if policy voided for non-disclosure
Must take reasonable care to provide accurate information
Failure to disclose changes may result in claim rejection
Call recording notice for monitoring and quality purposes
GDPR/Data Protection compliance - full privacy notice provided
Information may be shared with fraud prevention agencies
Credit searches may be performed (soft search, doesn't affect credit rating)

common_questions.question: What happens if my home is unoccupied for more than 60 days?
common_questions.answer: Many covers are suspended including theft, escape of water, malicious damage, oil escape. You must notify insurer immediately if property becomes unoccupied. Cover can be arranged but with restrictions. 'Lived in' means occupied at least 5 nights in a row each month OR 2 nights in a row each week.
common_questions.section_reference: Definition of 'Unoccupied' page 6; Exclusions throughout Sections 1 and 2

common_questions.question: Are my valuables covered away from home?
common_questions.answer: Only if you have Section 3 - Personal Possessions and Valuables cover. This provides worldwide cover but with limits: £2,500 per unspecified item, £1,500 from unattended vehicle, £2,000 for jewellery theft from hotel rooms. Items over £2,500 must be specified on Schedule.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 3 - Personal Possessions and Valuables, page 32-33

common_questions.question: What security do I need for my pedal cycle when away from home?
common_questions.answer: Cycles must be in a secured locked building OR secured through the frame by a locked security device to an immovable object. For cycles valued over £1,500, must use a 'Sold Secure Gold' standard lock, and you must provide proof of ownership of this lock (receipt, photo, bank statement, or retailer confirmation).
common_questions.section_reference: Section 4 - Pedal Cycles page 34; Claim Conditions page 14-15

common_questions.question: Does Buildings cover include my garden walls and fences?
common_questions.answer: Walls and fences ARE included in the Buildings definition, but have limited cover. They are NOT covered for: storm damage, damage from falling trees, subsidence (unless main building damaged at same time). They ARE covered for: fire, flood, impact, theft, malicious damage (if property not unoccupied).
common_questions.section_reference: Definition of Buildings page 4; Section 1 exclusions pages 17-18

common_questions.question: What if I need to make a structural change to my property?
common_questions.answer: You must notify insurer before starting any: extensions, work on load-bearing walls, roofing work over 20%, structural works including demolition, or any works costing 50%+ of Buildings sum insured. Failure to notify may result in no cover during works and subsidence claims being excluded.
common_questions.section_reference: General Conditions - Changes you must tell us about, page 8; Section 1 exclusion 10(f), page 18

common_questions.question: Am I covered if my tenant damages the property?
common_questions.answer: No - damage by tenants or occupants is excluded. However, if you are a tenant yourself, you have Tenant's Liability cover (Section 2K) which covers your legal liability for damage to the landlord's building, up to 10% of Contents sum insured, excluding fire/lightning/explosion to building structure.
common_questions.section_reference: General Exclusions 8, page 13; Section 2K - Tenant's Liability, page 28

common_questions.question: How quickly must I report a theft to the police?
common_questions.answer: Ideally within 24 hours of discovery. You must obtain a crime reference number. For riot, you must inform police within 7 days. Failure to report to police within reasonable time may affect your claim.
common_questions.section_reference: Claim Conditions page 14; Section 1 exclusion 9, page 19; Section 2 exclusion 9, page 24

common_questions.question: What is covered for alternative accommodation if I can't live in my home?
common_questions.answer: Up to 20% of your Buildings or Contents sum insured for accommodation of same standard as your existing home, plus storage of contents, for you and domestic pets. Not covered: costs recoverable elsewhere, costs without insurer agreement, costs after property ready for habitation, if property not going to be reinstated.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 1C - Loss of rent/alternative accommodation page 19; Section 2C - Alternative accommodation page 25

common_questions.question: Are business items covered in my home?
common_questions.answer: Very limited cover. Business Equipment (computers and office equipment for clerical purposes only) up to £5,000 is covered. No other business property is covered. Professional/trade use beyond clerical work is excluded.
common_questions.section_reference: Definition of Contents page 4; Definition of Business Equipment page 4; General Exclusions 8, page 13

common_questions.question: What should I do immediately after discovering damage?
common_questions.answer: 1. Take steps to prevent further damage (e.g. turn off water/gas); 2. If theft/criminal damage, report to police within 24 hours for crime reference; 3. Do NOT dispose of damaged items; 4. Do NOT carry out permanent repairs; 5. Take photos if possible; 6. Contact claims line 08000 327327 (24/7) as soon as practical; 7. Keep all receipts for emergency measures.

common_questions.question: Is subsidence covered?
common_questions.answer: Yes, subsidence, heave and landslip are covered under Section 1 number 10 and Section 2 number 10. However, there are significant exclusions: damage to drives, patios, walls, fences, fuel tanks, pools (unless main building damaged); damage to solid floors (unless foundations beneath walls damaged); normal settlement; coastal erosion; damage during structural works; compensation available elsewhere. Check Schedule for any subsidence excess or exclusion endorsement.
common_questions.section_reference: Section 1 number 10, page 18; Section 2 number 10, page 24

common_questions.question: Can I cancel my policy and get a refund?
common_questions.answer: Yes. Within 14 days (cooling off): full refund if not started, pro-rata if started. After 14 days: pro-rata refund for unused cover. However, NO refund if you have made a claim or are in the process of making a claim in the current period. If paying by instalments and claim is settled, you must continue payments to renewal or amount will be deducted from claim payment. Minimum refund is £10.
common_questions.section_reference: General Conditions 4 - Cancellation, page 9; General Conditions 14 - Refunds, page 11

common_questions.question: What are the index linking provisions?
common_questions.answer: Buildings and Contents sums insured are adjusted monthly. Buildings linked to House Rebuilding Cost Index (RICS). Contents linked to Consumer Durable Section of Retail Price Index. Your renewal premium is calculated on the adjusted sum insured. Sums insured continue to increase during claims if you ensure repairs done without undue delay. Valuables and Personal Possessions are NOT index linked - you must ensure adequate cover.

common_questions.question: What is covered for escape of water?
common_questions.answer: Damage from water escaping from fixed water tanks, apparatus or pipes is covered. Also covers frost damage to these items. However, NOT covered: while unoccupied, taps left on causing overflow (unless you have accidental damage cover), damage to fuel tanks or swimming pools, subsidence (covered separately). Also covered: tracing the leak (up to £5,000) and increased water charges (up to £1,000).
common_questions.section_reference: Section 1 number 4, page 17; Section 1G Trace & access, page 20; Section 1E Loss of water, page 20

common_questions.question: Do I need to have valuations for my valuable items?
common_questions.answer: Yes, for all Valuables valued in excess of £2,500 you must hold an appropriate valuation no more than 3 years old, which must be made available if you claim. For jewellery over £7,500, must be inspected by professional jeweller (NAJ member) at least every 3 years with defects remedied. Failure to provide valuation may affect claim payment.
common_questions.section_reference: General Conditions 7 - Proof of value, page 10; Section 3 exclusion (e), page 32
